column2: Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning     Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness     Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices         What you'll do:               You are an expert in workforce management bringing a wealth of experience to the table     You leverage on historical data, seasonality, and industry trends to provide and clearly communicate actionable insights into improving forecast accuracy and enhance interval level resource allocation     You are driven by results and bias for action     Your efforts are geared towards achieving tangible outcomes that bring value to our customers through team work, relationship building and effective communication with different stakeholders and leaders             Own long, medium, and short term planning cycles - from forecasting, capacity planning to intraday management.     Provide enhancements to the existing locked forecast process. Optimize long-term planning, from workload input, process, and tools.     Forecast volumes and productivity assumptions across all channels and lines of businesses using historical data, trends, seasonality and events. Quickly identify and explain fluctuations in volume, AHT, and other assumptions to adjust resources accordingly.     Build forecast models and scenarios to support product initiatives. Provide analysis to assess and mitigate risk associated with every scenario.     Distribute daily and interval workload forecast by site six weeks in advance.     Build weekly performance reports tracking forecast delivery ability to interpret and present actual performance through slides and graphs.         What you'll bring:         First, A high level of dedication, enthusiasm, motivation, and persuasive ability in a team and cross-functional environment     A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Math and/or Business or equivalent experience     5+ years of hands-on experience in operational forecasting, capacity planning, and scheduling for a multi-location operation.     Previous Capacity Planning / Forecasting experience strongly preferred as well as experience with business intelligence and analytics.     Experience working with senior leaders in automating and implementing new systems and processes.     To build complex models using various statistical tools for optimization and then communicating data, plans or risks clearly and succinctly.     To be proficient experience in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets required; SQL is a big plus. Some programming experience is a plus.             About Walmart Global Tech           Flexible, hybrid work:   We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite     Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs     This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives             Benefits:         Benefits Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance     Other great perks include a host of best-in-class benefits maternity and parental leave, PTO, health benefits, and much more                 Minimum Qualifications         Bachelors degree in Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, or related field and 1 years experience in data management, business analytics, statistics, or related area OR 3 years experience in data analysis, statistics, computer science, or related area.

column2: Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning      Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and ensuring diversity awareness      Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices                    What youll do:              You are an expert in workforce management bringing a wealth of experience to the table.      You leverage on historical data, seasonality, and industry trends to provide and clearly communicate actionable insights into improving forecast accuracy and enhance interval level resource allocation.      You are driven by results and bias for action. Your efforts are geared towards achieving tangible outcomes that bring value to our customers through team work, relationship building and effective communication with different stakeholders and leaders.        Own long, medium, and short term planning cycles - from forecasting, capacity planning to intraday management.      Provide enhancements to the existing locked forecast process. Optimize long-term planning, from workload input, process, and tools.      Forecast volumes and productivity assumptions across all channels and lines of businesses using historical data, trends, seasonality and events. Quickly identify and explain fluctuations in volume, AHT, and other assumptions to adjust resources accordingly.      Build forecast models and scenarios to support product initiatives. Provide analysis to assess and mitigate risk associated with every scenario.      Distribute daily and interval workload forecast by site six weeks in advance.      Build weekly performance reports tracking forecast delivery ability to interpret and present actual performance through slides and graphs.            What youll bring:          First, A high level of dedication, enthusiasm, motivation, and persuasive ability in a team and cross-functional environment      A Bachelor s degree with an emphasis in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Math and/or Business or equivalent experience      8+ years of hands-on experience in operational forecasting, capacity planning, and scheduling for a multi-location operation.      Previous Capacity Planning / Forecasting experience strongly preferred as well as experience with business intelligence and analytics.      Experience working with senior leaders in automating and implementing new systems and processes.      To build complex models using various statistical tools for optimization and then communicating data, plans or risks clearly and succinctly.      To be proficient experience in Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets required; SQL is a big plus. Some programming experience is a plus.

column1: Finance Group Fin Control AS Professional
column2: The Corporate finance team performs global and seamless Finance operations including trading and product control, Group financial reporting and disclosure, management information and reporting for decision support, planning and development of financial strategy including funding policies and financial analysis, funding and cash management, tax planning and reporting, investor relations management, and much more.                 Business Unit Overview:           Finance and Capital Reporting (FCR) is a key component of the Finance Department, which has an excellent reputation within the bank and externally     The unit is responsible for ensuring that the firm is adequately capitalised at all times against its risk weighted assets as well as maintaining leverage asset levels under regulatory limits, identifying any threats to the viability of the firm helping the management identify appropriate actions and ensures timely production of key balance sheet metrics as required by regulators             The unit covers areas as follows:             Group Reporting:    Ensuring Financial statements are complete, accurate, prepared in a timely manner, and are in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) on a legal entity and a consolidated basis.       External Reporting:    Ensuring regional regulatory returns are produced and submitted timely covering financial statements, capital ratios, leverage ratio and risk weighted assets on monthly / quarterly / annual basis       Daily reporting:    Ensuring daily production of capital adequacy components such as counterparty credit risk, market risk, large exposure risk, settlement risk, CVA risk, leverage ratios, management balance sheet to Senior management       Finance Policy:    Provide guidance and support to the reporting teams on the interpretation of existing and future accounting and capital requirements                         Position Specifications:    CA / CFA / FRM is a plus           Role & Responsibilities:               The role covers responsibilities for running processes and projects in the Finrep team, which forms part of the External Financial and Capital Reporting of the European consolidation group and its regulated subsidiaries. It will include working with colleagues in Mumbai, London, Frankfurt, Paris and Tokyo.     The role will encompass accurate production and timely submission of monthly/ quarterly/ annual regulatory returns stating the financial positions of EMEA entities:     Understanding the business model, financial transactions and position of EMEA entities.     Perform due diligence of the numbers reported by establishing quality controls around the processes.     Ensuring Financial disclosures are complete, accurate & prepared in a timely manner and are in accordance with applicable GAAP s.     Liaising with the regional Controllers for financial reporting process.     Prepare periodic management review packs and provide analytical commentary for key variances.     Responding to business / management driven queries & requests.     Development of monthly/ quarterly MI through new age BI tools such as Alteryx and Power BI.     Interaction with other teams like IT, Ops, LE Controllers and Legal     Driving standardization of process over time, Process efficiency and ensuring focus on added value work.     Defining business requirements for IT implementation in case of new projects / process enhancements.     User Acceptance testing of implementation with an eye for identifying gaps under different scenarios     The role will be challenging and will provide a variety of responsibilities covering technical, process & interpersonal skill sets.      It will be an excellent opportunity to develop knowledge of regulatory financial and leverage reporting providing a deep insight into financial positions of EMEA entities.                     Mandatory Desired Domain           Financial services industry exposure         Good working knowledge in         Financial reporting function with exposure to IFRS and US GAAP Capital Market knowledge Excellent communication skills & ability to communicate ideas concisely and clearly     Ability to work in stringent deadlines Ability to deliver accurate reports within agreed timelines     Proficiency in bringing issues to closure by keeping all the relevant stakeholders informed.     Previous experience in Financial reporting / Capital reporting within Investment Banking is preferred     Understanding of financial products     Self-starter, problem solver and ability to work with minimal     supervision                     Technical           Advanced Excel and PowerPoint skills and ability to learn Finance specific systems     Inquisitive mind set with ability to challenge the norm     Working knowledge with Tableau, Power BI, Alteryx, Excel VBA macros and SQL and ability to self -learn similar new age IT tools
column11: Financial statements, US GAAP, Financial reporting, Financial analysis, Corporate finance, Cash management, Capital market, IFRS, Balance Sheet, Financial services

column2: Analytics Manager, App (Remote)   Experience:  6+ years Salary:  INR 4,04,761 / month Expected Notice Period : 2 to 4 Weeks Shift : 11:00AM to 7:00PM IST Opportunity Type:  Remote Placement    Type:  Permanent   (*Note: This is a requirement for one of Uplers' clients)   What do you need for this opportunity? Primary Skills : A/B Testing, Clickstream, Tableau, Team Lead, Data Visualisation, Good Team Player, Problem Solving Attitude, SQL, Strong Attention To Detail Assessment:  Role based AI Screening covering Communication and Technical Skills   Our Hiring Partner is Looking for: Analytics Manager, App (Remote) who is passionate about their work, eager to learn and grow, and who is committed to delivering exceptional results. If you are a team player, with a positive attitude and a desire to make a difference, then we want to hear from you.   Roles & Responsibilities About Role:   As the Manager of App Analytics, you will be responsible for leading a team and managing stakeholders to provide valuable insights into our business. A strong command of SQL and a deep understanding of clickstream data are essential for success in this role. Experience with Tableau and a proven track record of handling clickstream data are required, while experience with AB testing is highly desirable.   Key Responsibilities: Lead and manage a team to deliver actionable insights to internal stakeholders. Manage relationships with key stakeholders across various departments. Utilize SQL to extract and analyze data from our databases to derive insights. Develop and maintain dashboards in Tableau to visualize key metrics and trends. Dive deep into clickstream data to understand user behavior and identify opportunities for optimization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement AB tests to drive business outcomes. Present findings and recommendations to senior management in a clear and concise manner. Qualifications: Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in team management, with a total of 6+ years of relevant experience. Proficiency in SQL with the ability to write complex queries to extract and manipulate data. Strong understanding of clickstream data and its importance in driving business decisions. Prior experience working with Tableau or similar data visualization tools. Experience with AB testing methodologies is highly desirable. Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to influence stakeholders. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field. Experience :  Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in team handling, with an overall experience of 6+ years. Non-negotiable Skills: Experience with the Clickstream data is non-negotiable. Engagement Type: TripAdvisor is Hiring Payroll and Compliance will be managed by KaamWork Location: Remote Job Type: Full-Time Permanent How to apply for this opportunity? Register or login on our portal & fill out the application Clear the given AI Screening (30 min) and Click on Apply to get shortlisted Our team of talent matchmakers will matchmake you with the client Crack a quick interview with our client Land your global dream job and get your exciting career started!   About our Hiring Partner: Tripadvisor, the world's largest travel guidance platform*, helps hundreds of millions of people each month** become better travelers, from planning to booking to taking a trip. Travelers across the globe use the Tripadvisor site and app to discover where to stay, what to do and where to eat based on guidance from those who have been there before. With more than 1 billion reviews and opinions of nearly 8 million businesses, travelers turn to Tripadvisor to find deals on accommodations, book experiences, reserve tables at delicious restaurants and discover great places nearby. As a travel guidance company available in 43 markets and 22 languages, Tripadvisor makes planning easy no matter the trip type.   About Uplers: Our goal is to make hiring reliable, simple, and fast. Our role will be to help all our talents find and apply for relevant opportunities and progress in their career. We will support any grievances or challenges you may face during the engagement. You will also be assigned to a dedicated Talent Success Coach during the engagement.    ( Note:  There are many more opportunities apart from this on the portal. Depending on the assessments you clear, you can apply for them as well).    So, if you are ready for a new challenge, a great work environment, and an opportunity to take your career to the next level, don't hesitate to apply today. We are waiting for you!

column2: HR Workforce Planning  The HR Workforce Planning job is responsible for reviewing quantitative analysis and predictive modeling for the purpose of analyzing an organization's future workforce needs, implementing a workforce plan and associated talent management strategies, and managing "what if" scenario planning and analysis. As a subject matter expert in workforce planning, this job leads the design and implementation of workforce plans across all functional areas. This job manages larges workforce planning projects and also analyzes trends and opportunities that will be used to build workforce plans.  Role & responsibilities   Manages workforce planning data which advises and enables human resources programs and provides the business with important insights. Leading talent data research and analysis function aiming at driving business results. Implements and maintains various status reports and tracking tools. Optimizing the operation processes including talent data collection, management, modeling and reports generation; evaluating the possible deployment of advanced analytic tools and methodologies. Identifies process improvement opportunities to ensure data integrity and drive time/cost efficiencies. Identifying business strategic goals and existing operational issues; arranging relevant talent analytic project to seek talent solution for the issues. Reviews and approves implementation plans for all designed human resources and workforce initiatives. Directing, motivating, developing and managing the performance of the talent analytic team and key staff. Provides insights and analytics that are used to drive talent management decisions. Oversees workforce databases to ensure data integrity and reviews for trend analysis. Analyzes drivers of significant forecast misses to continuously improve workforce forecasting. Coaches, reviews, and delegates work to lower level professionals and ensures high-quality and timely completion of projects. Preferred candidate profile Someone with Workday Reporting with Composite report and calculated field experience. Someone who has experience in Worksheet and Data discovery board.

column2: Argus is seeking a         Lead Consultant         (Principal Consultant)         to provide subject matter expertise for our         olefins         subscription services, including market reports, price forecasts/monthly outlooks, and biannually released fundamentals analytics with forecasts (capacities, supply, demand and trade flows)                     This senior position is pivotal to Argus global success               You         will support the Vice President and work closely with other consultants and analysts across the sector in various regional offices to deliver high-quality products, engage with clients and develop product innovation and industry insights                           Cultivate deep understanding of Asian olefins-related markets,         deep understanding of capacity development, the cost to produce from the various routes, the dynamics of the PP/PE chain and understanding of the dynamics of         the other derivatives - EO/PO/ACN etc. and their downstream chains.         Forge strong business relationships with petrochemical industry executives,      industry     and client relationships.         Share key, actionable business insights from industry meetings with the sector.         Establish themself as a thought leader underpinned by consistent marketing and business development output, including industry presentations and client meetings.         Verify data integrity and global data flow and contribute to         olefins         fundamental analytics and monthly price outlooks.         Continuously look for ways to improve the product deliverables and make the process and coordination more efficient.         Support the sector s annual AAV growth targets by prioritizing client needs with product development and innovation.         Work closely with Data, Data Science and Technology teams, as required, to improve efficiency and speed of deliverables and support the Chemical Analytics vision for the development of dashboards and scenario analysis tools.                           What we re looking for in you     :                   5-10         years of recent experience focused on pricing, market conditions and trends,         capacity         and supply demand for         ethylene and      olefins         Minimum      bachelor s degree in chemical engineering     , Chemistry,      Economics         or industry-related fields.         High level of understanding of petrochemicals,      oil     and gas.         Research and analysis experience from planning departments and/or consulting positions is a plus.         Highly accomplished collecting, monitoring,      analysing     and communicating market data.         Experienced conducting regional and/or global market analyses that identify and interpret economic drivers, supply/demand fundamentals, trade flows and capacity data.         Excellent communication skills with the ability to network and build contacts with industry executives.         Comfortable with preparing and delivering presentations to industry professionals.         Strong experience with Microsoft Office         (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, Project.         Experience with R, Python or SQL is preferred, but strong willingness to learn and technical aptitude is a requisite.         Able to work independently while         engaging and collaborating in line with the Argus values: Excellence, Integrity, Partnership, and Inclusivity.                                   What s in it for you:                   Competitive Compensation:     Enjoy a rewarding salary package coupled with an enticing company bonus scheme, acknowledging your      contributions     and incentivizing your continued excellence.         Flexibility Redefined:     Embrace a hybrid working model that seamlessly blends the best of both worlds three days in the vibrant office environment and two days of productive work from home, fostering work-life balance and maximizing productivity.         Wellness Assurance:     Prioritize your health and well-being with comprehensive group healthcare coverage, ensuring peace of mind for you and your loved ones.         Time to Recharge:     Rejuvenate and recharge with generous annual leave entitlement of 18 days, including additional 8 days of casual leave to unwind and pursue personal interests.         Continuous Growth:     Embark on a journey of continuous learning and development with extensive internal and external training opportunities, empowering you to stay at the forefront of industry trends and sharpen your skills.

column2: Role As our Business Analytics Manager, you will provide business expertise and direction on how clients can best leverage data and information to drive business and performance. The role would have a strong focus on Analytics product development as well. You will be required to own and shape the product vision and roadmap for our offerings in Analytics and work with businesses to execute them. You will be responsible for leading analytics consulting engagements and /or analytics product development work for internal and external clients. You will also be leading a team of data scientists, data analysts and / or data engineers to help you accomplish your roles & responsibilities.  You will be expected to manage new ideas from concept to launch, working closely with colleagues across the business. This will entail: High level functional and technical understanding of all Analytic projects to ensure leveraging of past work occurs for all new demand. Strong knowledge of machine learning, natural language processing, and statistical analysis methods. Working closely with the UX design team and business analysts to design the right AI/ML solution for users needs. Acting as the product owner in analytics product development initiatives. Defining rollout strategy and briefing marketing teams with required documentation for any new analytics product. Identifying the business model, understand delivery costs and advising on pricing. Engaging and collaborating with stakeholders More broadly, you will assess the offerings in your remit against their KPIs, manage them through their lifecycle and act as needed. With your background in ML and business analytics, you will also be a thought partner for your Product colleagues and evangelize the use of data to influence decision making. Requirements 8+ years into machine learning or data science, with 3+ years as Analytics Lead with team management experience. Strong knowledge and experience of data analytics ( ML / BI / business analytics, reporting platforms and data visualization techniques and tools). Hands on experience in Python and any BI tool is mandatory.  Proven product ownership or management of BI/analytics offerings Outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English Ability to influence and persuade, build consensus, drive, and energize teams. Concise approach to problem solving with the ability to bring logical thinking and creative solutions to the table, delivering clarity and direction to projects. Apply superior judgment as it pertains to prioritizing work for yourself and others and escalating roadblocks when necessary.

column2: Model validation plays a critical role within OSB. Working within the Risk and Compliance team there is a large opportunity to shape the evolution of model validation within the organisation providing real benefit to the Group.     The key purpose of this role is to perform individually end to end model validation activity as an Independent Contributor & mentor the junior resources on the same as first point of reviewer, across a breadth of models and purposes (both material and non-material) ensuring that high materiality models are subject to robust independent validation providing assurance to key model committees that the models are assured as to their quality and risk.     Core Responsibilities      Support the Head of Model Validation in improving polices, standards and practices across the validation function including:      Input into validation policies and standards by making recommendations and sharing experience and expertise.     Lead the end to end hands on validation activities to complete any validation projects.     Proving guidance & mentorship to junior resources around validation activities.     Conduct first point review of validation papers & highlight improvement areas to juniors.     Providing opinion on regulatory requirements and emerging practice such that recommendations may be made.     Maintaining validation evidence to enable audit reviews.     Being an advocate for model validation throughout the organisation, supporting training and awareness sessions as required.         Validation of material and non-material models across all aspects of the model lifecycle. This will include assessing the appropriateness of the data utilised, the methodologies, the performance of the model, the clarity of the model documentation, appropriateness of model monitoring, and the use of the model. In practice you will be expected to:      Perform independent analysis utilising statistical techniques to interrogate, review and challenge model development.     Engage with the Head of Model Validation on findings and recommended materiality.     Provide clarity to the model owner / model developer as to the findings / query such that the matter is understood.     Utilise expertise to agree any remedial actions with the model development team.     Provide, where relevant, views on regulatory compliance.     Produce comprehensive validation reports in line with the validation framework for review at the appropriate Committee / approval body.         Maintain the company s compliance standards and ensure timely completion of all mandatory on-line training modules and attestations.     Line manage and coach all direct reports, including all aspects of performance management, development, conduct, sickness management, appraisals, employee administration and recruitment.     Management and engagement stakeholders across the organisation to ensure effect model validation practice is embedded.     Deputise for the Group Head of Validation as required.     Experience Requirements      4 - 6 years experience working within a similar model validation or model development related role is essential.     Significant experience of credit risk models including IFRS 9, preferably obtained within an IRB accredited / aspirant firm is essential.     Significant experiences of utilising quantitative analysis is essential.     Significant experience of writing reports for senior committees is desirable.     Good experience of risk models across numerous disciplines is desirable.     Significant knowledge of regulatory expectations in relation to model validation at an IRB aspiring or accredited firm is desirable.     Knowledge Requirements      Sound understanding of model risk and the model lifecycle is desirable.     Specialist understanding of Credit Risk models and techniques is essential.     Specialist technical knowledge of quantitative analysis is essential.     Advanced mathematical, modelling and quantitative analysis skills are essential     Advanced use and application of data modelling and data analysis software: specifically SAS, WPS or similar are essential     Excellent IT skills: of Microsoft Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Visual Basic are essential     Excellent verbal and written communication skills are essential     Up to date knowledge of PRA and EBA requirements are essential, including IRB requirements     Experience in mentoring junior team members around coding, analysis and other validation activities.     Excellent skills in respect of verbal and written communication are essential.     Qualifications/Certifications      A degree or equivalent qualification in a quantitative field is essential.
column11: Data analysis, Assurance, Visual Basic, SAS, Performance management, Coding, IFRS, Monitoring, Recruitment, Auditing

column2: In this role you ll have the opportunity to be a part of Target s digital acceleration in supporting the growth of Target s exciting new marketplace Target Plus. Target Plus is a differentiated marketplace platform that aims to offer guests a seamless online shopping experience. In this role, you will support the Partner Communications space, which is critical to ensure that our Partners (what we call Sellers) have a great experience selling on our Platform. The scope of the Partner Communications team includes managing our operational email communication to our Partners, our Partner facing documents, our Help Center and Webinars. Partner Communications falls under a broader Change & Communications team that cares for the holistic roadmap for large change initiatives within our Target Plus platform.   In this role, you will provide analyst and project management support to the Partner Communications space. The scope of this role is broad as it will support all areas of our Partner Communications (email, new content, Help Center, Webinars) and it will therefore require you to lead multiple cross-functional efforts requiring engagement with the entire Target Plus team (Acquisition, Item, Category Management, Partner Services, Onboarding, Support & Performance teams). You will be expected to be able to navigate ambiguity as many of the routines and processes within the communications space are new and evolving. This role will require a high degree of self-initiative and independence given the global partnership with and dependency on the Minneapolis based Change & Communications team. A successful candidate will be able to demonstrate superior communication skills, high accountability and cross-functional leadership with a wide scope.                 PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES         Provide ongoing analyst support to recap performance and identify opportunities in support of the following communications & knowledge channels:     operational email     help center     webinars     Complete ongoing and routine competitive benchmarking research to identify opportunities for the further evolution of our communications & knowledge channels:     Operational email     Help center     Webinars     Provide project management support in facilitating new routines in support of a new Content Library where we will house all Partner facing documents that are owned across the entire Target Plus team     Provide support as needed in development of new Partner content / documents (includes training modules) in partnership with TII Marketing & Creative team     Analyse partner experience KPIs and interpret insights to drive actions as needed             REQUIREMENTS         Graduate degree in any field of study     At least 4 years working experience in onboarding, service or support roles in digital, business-to-business (B2B), or other customer/client facing industry     Ability to conceptualize ideas and articulate the same to senior stakeholders within the organization     Ability to articulate initiatives, business cases, progress reports using MS Power Point     Ability to influence without authority     Stakeholder management     Project Management abilities in defining, planning and execution of projects and initiatives     Structured problem solving abilities through critical thinking, logical reasoning and data analysis     Excellent communication skills, in both large and small group presentations     Ability to make complex ideas simple to understand     Knowledge of e-commerce processes and systems
column11: Data analysis, Senior Analyst, Project management, Category management, Conceptualization, E-commerce, Stakeholder management, Powerpoint, Operations, Competitive benchmarking

column2: The Senior Manager, Data Services, within the Customer Adoption department, is a leadership role responsible for orchestrating and delivering data-centric solutions to clients and supporting internal stakeholders data initiatives.      This position requires proficiency in driving the development of data models, dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide actionable insights to support business decisions.      This position is for someone who has deep customer consulting background, strong business acumen, solid understanding of data and technology, and can build a strong services team, manage the team performance, and improve delivery processes.      The Senior Manager will collaborate closely with diverse clients, champion data-driven decision-making, and be instrumental in harnessing data for strategic growth.     As the Senior Manager, Data Services, reporting to VP of Product Consulting Services, you will be responsible for leading and managing a global team of data analysts and data consultants.      As a leader of the team, you will be responsible for overseeing the design, implementation, and management of data related initiatives; building and integrating tools to increase data management efficiency; delivering data analytics and insights for informed decision-making and strategic growth, for both internal stakeholder and customers.     The Senior Manager, Data Services will play a critical role in the success of our Customer Adoption Team.          Responsibilities:         Manage and develop team of data analyst and data consultants, including hiring, training, performance management, career pathing and mentoring.     Oversee data analysts and data consultants delivery of all data initiatives and implementation engagements.     Collaborate directly with clients to understand their unique data needs and translate these into actionable data analytics and reporting solutions.      Ensure that data initiatives are closely aligned with client business objectives and deliver measurable value.     Forge strong relationships with client leadership, analysts, and other stakeholders to grasp their data-related requirements.     Serve as point of escalation for clients and internal stakeholders, with regards to ongoing support and delivery challenges.     Directly involve in complex data delivery engagements and develop deep expertise in 6sense platform and services.     Collaborate with other customer success teams on the staffing and allocation of resources.     Assist Customer Success team and Product Consultants on implementation scoping and deal development.     Work with Service Operation teams on monthly and quarterly measurement of key delivery metrics.     Responsible for utilization targets and maintaining optimal delivery margins.     Manage relationships with third-party vendors and partners involved in data services.         Qualifications:          3+ years in a leadership or managerial capacity building and managing high performance teams with a demonstrated track record of identifying and developing talent.     7+ years in data management, data analytics, or related roles.         5+ years of customer facing consulting experience in any one or more of the following B2B related applications:         CRM (Customer Relationship Management)         SFDC, Microsoft Dynamics, SugarCRM, FreshSales or other B2B CRM applications     Focus in the area of Sales force automation (SFA), Lead Management and Marketing         MAP (Marketing Automation Platform)         Eloqua, Marketo, Pardot, Hubspot, FreshMarketer, Silverpop, Act-on or related B2B focused MAP     Focus on marketing automation, lead scoring, lead nurturing and campaigns automation         Strong proficiency in data analytics tools, data visualization platforms, and database technologies.     Analytical mindset with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.     Project management experience and a track record of successful project delivery.     Experience working with and managing teams in geographically diverse locations globally.     Experience working with multiple customers simultaneously in a high-energy, fast paced environment, utilizing consultative problem-solving skills.     Proven ability to develop clear and concise written technical and non-technical documentation.     Strong verbal presentation skills

column1: Analytical Insights Manager ( non management position)
column2: Boeing India  is currently looking for an  Analytical Insights Manager  (non management position)  to join our team .  This position will focus on  supporting the Boeing Global Services (BGS) business organization .  You will work in a one-of-a-kind organization with fascinating solutions that make a difference for real people all around the world and at every second of the day. You will be surrounded by extremely smart and talented colleagues who will be up for any challenge and who will not hesitate to challenge you. A successful candidate will be a self-starter who understands the importance of collaboration as this position will be responsible for providing advanced analytical insights to customers around the globe. Position Responsibilities: Help customers, both internal and external, understand and solve complex problems and maximize efficiency while leveraging Boeings Digital Offerings. Generate advanced analytical insights; using large data sets identify root causes, threats, errors, and opportunities so that they can be actioned. Communicate analytical insights in an easily digestible and actionable manner. Works directly with customers and stakeholders to scope analytical projects, obtain relevant data, validate findings, and share results. Exercises critical thinking and innovative problem solving. Ensures customer commitments and service levels are achieved or exceeded. Develops and maintains strategic partnerships with customers, stakeholders and peers. Maintain SME level awareness of several of Boeings Digital Aviation Solutions (DAS) products. Some travel will be required. Demonstrates the Boeing Behaviors in a deliberate and observable way. This is an individual contributor role managing analysis and customer partnership. Basic Qualifications  (Required Skills/Experience): Minimum of five years Aeronautical experience including: Aerospace engineering background, flight deck operations, piloting, commercial airline operations, or military flight operations. Minimum of five years analytical experience. Strong presentation skills to executive level audience. Strong communication and customer relationship management skills. Candidate must be able to support our global customer base with a flexible work schedule which may include late or early meetings. Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): Bachelor's degree or higher Experience presenting data insights Experience with data mining and data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI. Experience with flight safety programs such as  Flight Operations Quality Assurance (FOQA) / Flight Data Monitoring (FDM). Piloting or reliability engineering experience. Familiarity with aircraft recorded flight data. Typical Education & Experience: Education/experience typically acquired through advanced education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 10 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience Relocation: This position offers relocation.

column2: The Manager Customer Support Analytics role will be responsible for executing the development of high value insights. This is expected mainly by leveraging data, mathematical and analytical techniques and data reporting capabilities. The role is responsible for the execution of cutting-edge advanced data science and analytics initiatives for the Global Customer Support team.                  The role will translate, summarize, and present large and complex datasets in an easily understandable manner, making is possible to spot patterns, trends and correlations. This position will also design and deploy effective data pipelines, data visualizations and storytelling techniques to generate insights from data.                  The role will be an individual contributor role who is a hands-on analytics professional solving different use cases to provide value for different business units within the Customer Support organization. column2: This individual is responsible for managing the Business Analytics practice for Marketing function at Saks India. The role will directly serve Saks Marketing/Media leaders through executive reporting, insight generation and ad hoc analysis to solve business problems. The role will report directly to Director - Marketing Analytics in India and communicate with senior leaders in the Business Units across geographies. This managerial role is key in building the Business Analytics team and will serve as a liaison between the North American Analytics and India Analytics teams. Support areas will span Executive Reporting, Customer KPI Dashboard, International Sales Analyses, Segmentation and CRM, Analytics Production Support, Acquisition Retention strategies, Loyalty program and more.     In this role, the manager will be responsible for idea generation, roadmap management and driving cross business unit efficiencies. The manager will play a key role in building out the Analytics Tech roadmap as it relates to automating the existing reporting, new data exploration as needed and operationalizing customer facing marketing programs. He/She would be creating longitudinal behavior data stores for customers and act as the analytics expert behind Saks#39;s   Omni channel data architecture.       The Business Analytics team will focus on providing best in-class support to multiple   stakeholder groups by analyzing gaps/opportunities, managing priorities through effective   communication and business benefit estimation. The team will also need to be familiar with a   wide range of tech stack to effectively leverage all critical data sources.                 As the manager, Business Analytics, you will:           Manage groups of data analytics professionals that use business data and statistical methods to provide insight into business performance. Suggest improvement areas and methods to drive top line growth. Implement analytical approaches, methodologies to assist in the interpretation of results. Create effective presentations/reports to management for decision making and strategic planning.     The Business Analytics practice at Saks India would have two internal functions - Business Intelligence Business Insights.You will develop these capabilities by building high performing teams, continue to support as a technical mentor on the architecture/design for reporting frameworks, with an objective to deliver error free, timely, actionable intelligence into business performance. You, along with the team will be responsible for       Creating end-to-end automated reporting capabilities, including supporting data engineering needs required for intermediary data transformations, creation of automation frameworks to run these regular reporting initiatives with zero manual intervention.   Become subject matter experts on a variety of data types, specializing in querying data from disparate data sources and relational databases     Develop dynamic, self-serve, near real time dashboards on data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker etc. The analysts in this team would be dashboard developers, with strong SQL expertise backed with programming on python/pyspark for automation.   Participate in the strategic development of system capabilities within business analytics teams including bespoke analyses to support variety of business stakeholders such as loyalty, promotions, omni channel customer journeys and business operations   Support Director of Business Analytics through ownership of specific stakeholder relationships and company goals   Develop fact-based strategic and tactical business plans for proofs of concept /presentations for leadership on key strategic marketing initiatives   Analyze business performance proactively, compare market trends and explore key opportunity areas for the business to focus on. The team would support ad-hoc analysisrequired by senior management by providing data backed business insights. Along with the SQL expertise, the analysts in this team would have an eye for detail, story telling thought process etc.         Who You Are:         A Masters / Bachelor#39;s degree with a minimum of 8 years of experience, preferably in Business Intelligence or a quantitative field like Information Science, Mathematics or Statistics.   5-7 years of experience into ecommerce B2C retail analytics domain, Fashion-retail is a plus       3-4 years#39; experience in marketing analytics, reporting insights, ad hoc analysis, data mining, data storytelling, data sciences, statistical analysis etc   4+ years managing people both individual contributors and teams / projects.   Hands on experience with a high-level programming language (e.g. Python, VB, etc..) and familiarity with Snowflake, Hive/Hadoop environments for data and proven ability to drive efficiencies through automation using Airflow or similar   Strong technical proficiency with Looker or Tableau or other business intelligence tools.   Working experience with Jira/project management set up       Strong attention to detail, willingness to wear multiple hats, building and tracking a work plan in a fast-paced environment and drive efficiencies to execute multiple projects simultaneously   Self-driven, curiosity and initiative, building and enriching new, rapidly growing tools insights.   Inquisitive thinker, with the ability to continuously iterate in processes and effective in collaboration across cross-functional teams               Job Qualifications        You also have:         Lead multiple functions within purview of Reporting and Analytics including but not limited to Executive Reporting, Adhoc analysis, CRM, Loyalty, Personalization, Promotions   Subject matter expertise on All Data / Database technologies including Data Engineering and Analytics Technology   Thought partnership for North American Analytics teams on Business Analytics and Analytics Automation     Managed a team of analysts /senior analysts responsible for individual projects   Built new analytic capabilities for Saks by translating business needs into analytic problems and seeking out the data necessary through internal and external partnerships   Identified and driven strategic priorities and provides best in-class support to Analytics teams by managing priorities through effective communication and business benefit estimation   Defined team vision and orchestrates projects, processes and cross-functional task forces to deliver meaningful outcomes in a global delivery setting   Prepared and delivered executive ready presentations highlighting insights and recommendations   Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations.         How Often You May Travel:         As per business requirement         Your Life and Career at Saks:           Be a part of a world-class team; work with an adventurous spirit; think and act like an owner- operator!   Exposure to rewarding career advancement opportunities, from retail to supply chain, to digital or corporate.   A culture that promotes a healthy, fulfilling work/life balance     Thank you for your interest in Saks. We look forward to reviewing your application.                   Thank you for your interest in Saks. We look forward to reviewing your application.         Saks provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability          Saks welcomes all applicants for this position. Should you be individually selected to participate in an assessment or selection process, accommodations are available upon request in relation to the materials or processes to be used.

Some specific responsibilities include:  Data analysis:  Analyzing sales data (productivity as well as sales efforts) to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement. Sales forecasting:  Using historical data and market trends to forecast future sales performance and identify opportunity areas. Performance tracking:  Monitoring sales team performance and providing insights into individual and team sales results. Reporting:  Preparing and presenting reports and dashboards to communicate sales performance and trends to management and other stakeholders. KPI tracking :  Monitoring key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales conversion rates, average order value, and customer acquisition cost. Market research :  Research market trends, customer behaviour, and competitor activities to support sales strategies. CRM management:  Utilizing customer relationship management (CRM) systems to track and analyse customer interactions and sales activities. Collaboration:  Working closely with sales teams, marketing teams, and other departments to gather relevant data and insights.  Preferred candidate profile     Between 3-7 years of relevant experience in strategic account planning and sales management preferably from top consulting companies with knowledge for Sales & CRM tools  Excellent academic credentials  Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent skills related data management & interpratation, sales forecasting, sales KPI tracking etc. including other industry best practices. Responsible, self-starter, capable of simultaneously handling multiple, multi-faceted projects and working under pressure. Ability to interface effectively and appropriately with individuals at senior levels, both within and outside the company. Sound business & commercial acumen. column2: Summary: We are seeking an experienced and motivated individual to join our Data Analytics department as a Team Leader. The ideal candidate will have 4 to 7 years of experience in data analytics and a proven track record of leading successful teams. As a Team Leader, you will be responsible for overseeing a team of data analysts and ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of data-driven insights to support business decision-making. Roles and Responsibilities: - Lead and manage a team of data analysts, providing guidance, support, and mentorship to ensure high-quality work output. - Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify business requirements and translate them into data analytics projects. - Develop and implement data analytics strategies, methodologies, and best practices to drive efficiency and effectiveness within the team. - Conduct regular performance evaluations and provide constructive feedback to team members to foster their professional growth. - Monitor and track team performance against key performance indicators (KPIs) and take necessary actions to address any performance gaps. - Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in data analytics and provide recommendations for process improvements and technology enhancements. - Ensure compliance with data privacy and security regulations and maintain data integrity throughout the analytics process. - Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate insights and findings to stakeholders. Qualifications: - Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as data science, statistics, or computer science. - 4 to 7 years of experience in data analytics, with a strong understanding of statistical analysis, data modeling, and data visualization techniques. - Proven experience in leading and managing teams, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills. - Proficiency in data analytics tools such as SQL, Python, R, and Tableau. - Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to think critically and make data-driven decisions. - Knowledge of data governance and data management principles. - Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines. Join our team and lead a group of talented data analysts to drive data-driven insights and contribute to the success of our organization. Apply now!

column2: Program lead - BI & Ops   Job Description As a  Program lead - BI & Ops , you will be required to research, gather and use data to provide the organization with solutions to various business issues. You will closely collaborate, and work with the operations, sales, and technology teams to plan and organize data requirements for different campaigns and undertake data analyses leading to an understanding of the productivity and throughput for every project. This analysis will in turn help operations stakeholders make informed decisions around team and projects P&L. You will also be responsible for benchmarking and measuring the performance of various projects and business verticals. One of the key objectives will be to improve and streamline information, and data flow across teams and streamline processes via required automation.   What you will do: Undertake research to solve business problems, you need to manipulate and extract insights from large and complex datasets.  Provide business insights to guide operations teams to better manage and improve business outcomes. Create analytical models and scorecards to help leadership better understand the underlying trends and key drivers of the business and support strategic initiatives. Create relevant dashboards and highlight actionable insights for clients across their campaigns. Have expertise in Power BI Report development including but not limited to: Building Analysis Services reporting models. Developing visual reports, KPI scorecards, and dashboards using Power BI desktop. Connecting data sources, importing data, and transforming data for Business intelligence. Capable of implementing row-level security on data along with an understanding of application security layer models in Power BI. Should have an edge over making DAX queries in Power BI desktop. Expert in using advanced-level calculations on the data set. Responsible for design methodology and project documentaries. Should be able to develop tabular and multidimensional models that are compatible with data warehouse standards.   Who you are: Bachelors degree in business, operations management or related field; a master?? degree in business administration will be an advantage. 5+ years of experience in a data specific or related role with minimum 2 years of team management experience. 2 to 3 years of experience working with a self-service BI tool, preferably Power BI or Tableau. Should be familiar and experienced in SQL. Knowledge of a variety of data analysis techniques, including clustering, factor analysis, and logistic regression; data/text mining, decision trees, would be a plus. Detail oriented and meticulous ??this is a key requirement. Ability to interact with business as well as technical teams. Ability and experience to document process, models, designs, and solutions and able to explain, represent, and discuss with the team. Analytical mindset with a problem-solving approach with a love for numbers. Ability to work in an agile environment with a focus on continuous improvement. Ability to prepare, analyse and synthesize data in an actionable and decision critical format. Excellent communication and articulation skills; with strong presentation and power point skills. An innate ability to remain calm and composed during times of uncertainty and stress; and should be comfortable working in a highly dynamic, start-up type of environment. Should be a creative and analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills.

column1: BPM and Process Mining COE Senior Manager
column2: Responsible for managing a large team to support the delivery of a wide range of business activities, helping to shape the strategic direction and implementation of plans, driving performance and advancing the agenda by working closely with the Functions, providing business oversight and operational assurance, and ensuring that standards, policies and procedures are fit for purpose and working effectively.        Role Synopsis         The Business Process Management and Process Mining Centre of Excellence is hosted by Global Business Services (GBS) and operates as a Shared Service providing BPM & Mining capability across the Group.     The purpose of this role is to develop and lead governed Business Architectures and Group capability in BPM that will help the Group to simplify, standardize and move towards agile continuous improvement using the Enterprise Activity Model Tool.     Design, develop and deliver the Business Architecture & Business Process Management (BA&BPM) strategy and drive adoption and maturity of BPM by BP. This includes accountability for end-to-end architecture design for enterprise-wide activities and data, actively working with the EAM Governance Board and the process mining toolset, data models and analytics to support across GBS processes and group to provide visibility of our implemented processes and identify and support improvement initiatives.     This role will help deliver a cultural as well as business change in BP, encouraging emphasis on management at a process level through direct authority for process architecture design; engagement with businesses, functions, GBS centres and BPOs and working with IT functions to deliver the efficient technology solutions to those undertaking BPM.             BPM covers a wide range of management activities, including:         Scope Management     Process & Procedural Documentation     Process Governance     Project delivery using BPM     Sustainable Continuous Improvement     Process Performance Indicators & Key Performance Indicators linking to strategic objectives     Risk & Compliance Management     Process Performance and Conformance Monitoring     Event Management             Key Accountabilities:         Build a safe, compliant culture in the BA & BPM CoE implementing and utilising the Office Safety Framework and Code of Conduct.     Leading a team with varied strengths made up of both direct and indirect staff passionate about building BPM capability within BP directed towards process standardization, simplification and optimization.     Ensure all HR accountabilities are undertaken for the team.     Building and supporting BPM domain expertise within the Business as a whole, but particularly among members of the BPM CoE, Business Architecture governance and BPM Community of practice     Preparation and agreement of annual budget and lead BPM CoE within budget, preparing GFO as required.     Plan and maintain BA & BPM Strategy to drive a common way of implementing processes across BP through BPM methodology and platform.     Act as ambassador of the BA models and for BPM within BP to include:     Looking for appropriate opportunities to promote BPM within the Group in order to gradually achieve successful implementation of BPM group wide.     Responding to all incoming enquiries about BPM, the EAM & EDM     Prioritize activities of team     Lead the EAM and EAM governance process, including:     Lead EAM structure and content including working through all change requests with respective requestor & brokering with other parties as needed, implementing changes agreed through formal EAM releases.     Work to mature the Governance model and incorporate appropriate new members as appropriate.     Host quarterly governance meetings covering wider agenda items agreed.     Handle EAM release every 6 months or as changes required instruct.     Handle development and integration of other Business Architectures as agreed, including oversight of any governance activities - this currently include the Group s process, data and emerging Risk & Control architectures.     Complete design authority for EAM and EDM, collaborating closely with relevant functional groups on legal and policy requirements, setting and maintaining BP s methods, standards and conventions for BPM ensuring they are scalable and fit for purpose for all business users including governance .     Set appropriate Quality Assurance standards to ensure integrity of database.     Align with and support other key initiatives in BP such as BP Requirements, System of Internal Control, Bills of IT & Simplification agenda.     Assist groups in the company to use the BPM methodologies & tools to support their respective agenda, working with multiple and multifaceted Strategic Performance Units and Business Units as well as major Programmes of Work and other projects with a view to supporting simplification, standardization and continuous improvement in a balanced way for the Group.     Support development of BPM capability in the Group by provision of BPM consultancy, training and ongoing mentor helping users adopt BPM as a detailed management approach.     Report activities/progress to EAM governance monthly.     Support delivery as appropriate, helping to deliver further development as required by the business.     Look out for Business Architecture & BPM developments and best practices BPM methodologies in support of business strategy and priorities.             Key Challenges:         Very exciting role due to the scale & complexity of BP s Enterprise landscape - planning of architecture needs to take the requirements & anticipated requirements of the whole Group into consideration.     Potentially working with all professions within BP.     Working with vendor, external partners and relevant institutions where needed.     Engagement & communication with a diverse range of users from process operators through to Group Leadership.             Essential Experience:         Expert line manager, capable of leading a diverse, dispersed team with differing skills.     Extensive knowledge of BP or experience of working in global multi-national or similar diverse business environments of similar scale and complexity.     Extensive experience, training or certification in BPM & Process Mining     Experience of managing and enterprise-wide architecture/s.     Proficiency in Business English.     Passion for driving continuous improvement with clear evidence of same in professional or business background.     Demonstrates experience in process management & reengineering.     Good interpersonal and communication skills required given diverse nature of operating landscape.     Exceptional influencing skills and the ability to negotiate broker agreement multi-functional and teams with multifaceted strengths towards common architectures and language.     Strong bias towards detailed management is crucial for this role given the proven focus on adhering to an architecture, standards & conventions and governance.         Skills:    Agility core practices, Analytical Thinking, Collaboration, Commercial acumen (Inactive), Communication, Creativity and Innovation, Data Analysis, Decision Making, Digital fluency, Integration, Managing strategic partnerships, Research and insights, Risk Management, Stakeholder Engagement, Stakeholder Management, Sustainability awareness and action

column2: As Data and Project Manager with AirlinePros International, you will play a critical role in overseeing and managing data-related projects including the creation of a comprehensive global database with multiple segments within the organization. You will work with our global offices and external parties like media agencies, governmental bodies, corporates, travel agencies and other relevant organisations across the world to populate the database. You will be responsible for planning, execution, and delivery of the organisational database, and other data initiatives, in close collaboration with different departments to achieve company objectives. The role requires a strong understanding of data management principles, project management methodologies, and excellent communication skills to effectively coordinate project activities. Experience in aviation and travel industries will be an added advantage.      Key roles and responsibilities       Plan and develop detailed project outlines and timelines, resources, and milestones for the creation of the global database.          Develop a project plan for data collection across departments and geographies.          Initiate and oversee data collection, processing, analysis, and suggestion of activities in alignment with project objectives.          Ensure the quality, integrity, accuracy, and security of the data.          Understand and document the objectives of developing and maintaining the company s global database including creating data storage and retrieval systems.          Coordinate project activities, track progress and ensure adherence to company policies and values in every geography and activity.          Ability to identify and mitigate risks, resolve issues, and escalate concerns as and when required to ensure success of the project.          Lead and motivate interdepartmental teams to achieve project goals.          Collaborate with all stakeholders including other data analysts to leverage the data effectively for decision-making and generating insights useful for marketing and other activities across departments.          Communicate and update project status periodically, risks, and other issues to management ensuring alignment and transparency.          Organizing data into different categories and maintaining electronic files          Troubleshooting database issues and implementing recovery procedures and safety protocols          Performing the daily activities of updating the global database.          Implementing policies and standards relating to the storage and access of data          Monitoring database efficiency and performance         Monitor the performance metrics of marketing mailers, analyse data and help generate and interpret reports to track progress and measure success against key performance indicators.          Identify issues if any, conduct post-project evaluations to identify lessons learnt, best practises, and areas for improvement.          Present key finding with suggestions for better targeting and traction to senior management and other stakeholders within the company          Manage stakeholder expectations and collect feedback proactively to drive continuous improvement         Designing and preparing reports for management          Developing and administering data management solutions using database software          Developing and implementing data administration policy, standards and models          Provide guidance and support to global team members and enable the development of a productive and harmonious work environment.        Qualifications       Proven experience and strong understanding of database creation and project management, methodologies, and best practices.          Proficiency in project management tools and software like JIRA, Asana, or any other equivalent.          Excellent communication, leadership, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.          Bachelor s or Master s degree in computer science, information systems, business administration or a related field.        Business skills       Knowledge of data analytics, business intelligence, and data visualization concepts are desirable.          Ability to adapt to different cultures and working hours and changing priorities and thrive in fast-paced dynamic environment.          Aviation and related project management experience with an airline or travel company will add to your lure.

column2: Location  Noida  Reporting: Country Head   Looking out for a strategically sound commercial excellence manager for one of the leading global medical device manufacturing organizations.  You will assume responsibility for defining and leading the sales efficiency indicators (KPIs) through appropriate analysis between sales & and marketing. You will manage projects across functions to integrate -global and local- projects into the portfolio while also playing a key role in any acquisition process to support the country manager.  Your future employer -  A global innovator in discreet healthcare solutions, this organization pioneers advanced medical devices, prioritizing dignity and independence for individuals facing intimate healthcare challenges.  Responsibilities -   Overseeing the implementation and monitoring of a business intelligence model to drive customer segmentation, targeting as well as CRM program.  Driving salesforce effectiveness initiatives & executing the global commercial excellence strategy.  Creating mechanisms to capture, analyse & use the market level data to understand the competitive landscape, identifying the growth opportunities and target customer segments.  Creating value propositions to support and build competitive advantage in cooperation with marketing & sales functions.  Translating strategic objectives into operational plans.  Supporting the country manager in business development by providing insights and competitive intelligence.  Driving continuous improvement by setting KPIs & objectives for the team and undertaking performance evaluations.  Overseeing the local deployment of the global commercial strategy.  Requirements -    Graduation/post-graduation from a top tier institute with 8+ years of professional experience in medical devices or pharmaceutical manufacturing organization.  Strong analytics experience and sound business acumen.  Strong team leading experience and ability to manage global stakeholders.  Whats in it for you?   High visibility role.  Global exposure and engagement.  Reach Us:    If you think this role is aligned with your career, kindly write me an email along with your updated CV on abhishek.pushkar@crescendogroup.in for a confidential discussion on the role. We are passionate about empowering job seekers and employers with an engaging memorable job search and leadership hiring experience. Crescendo Global does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.   Note: We receive a lot of applications on a daily basis, so it becomes a bit difficult for us to get back to each candidate. Please assume that your profile has not been shortlisted in case you don't hear back from us in 1 week. Your patience is highly   appreciated.
